headline.main: HISTORY OF 1852.; POLITICAL AND GENERAL HISTORY OF THE Principal Nations of the World. PART II. THE EUROPEAN STATES. General View of Europe. ENGLAND. POLITICAL HISTORY. FRANCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the exception of the Imperial movement in France, the history of the past year has been singularly destitute of striking events. It has, like that of the previous year, been marked by the steady development of those systems which have taken the place of the revolutionary projects of 1848 and 1849.

headline.main: From Washington--Confirmations--Removals--Trial Trid of the Steamer Water Witch--Mr. King's Health.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate to-day confirmed WILLIAM HENRY TREECOTT, a young South Carolinian, of respectable literary attainments as Secretary of Legation at the

docs.lead_paragraph: The new arrangement of the Congressional Districts in South Carolina is likely to produce some contest for the honor of serving the State at Washington. Messrs. Orr and Wallace were thrown into the same District, and therefore one of them must take a beating and stay at home. In Mr. Burt's old District, Messrs. J. F. Marshall, Brooks and Pickens have been announced before the District was marked out;

headline.main: BOARD OF ALDERMEN.; The Broadway Railroad.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board met yesterday evening, pursuant to adjournment, and a quorum being present, the minutes of the preceding meeting were read and approved. REPORTS ADOPTED--of Committee on Salaries and Offices, in favor of concurring to pay C. T. McCienchan as official reporter for the Board of Assistants, during the last year. Of Committee on Public Health, in favor of concurring with the Board of Assistants to fill in low and sunken lets and removing nuisance.

headline.main: The Health of lion. W. R. King.
SLAVERY IN THE SOUTH.; Uncle Tom's Cabin.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the National Intelligencer. Every nation has its "Uncle Tom's Cabin." Sentimental Germany had its "Sorrows of Werter," which caused floods of tears to be shed.
docs.snippet: From the National Intelligencer. Every nation has its "Uncle Tom's Cabin." Sentimental Germany had its "Sorrows of Werter," which caused floods of tears to be shed.
